title.native: THE IDOLM@STER MOVIE 輝きの向こう側へ
title.romaji: THE IDOLM@STER MOVIE: Kagayaki no Mukougawa e!

description:
The idols of 765 Production continue on their neverending journey—towards a new stage, towards a bright and shiny future!

The girls and their producer have gone through thick and thin, and have stood face to face with all kinds of difficulties.

It's time again for the girls to foster their friendship, and through great discipline, they step forward to their starry future.

(Source: Official website)
synonyms: The IDOLM@STER Movie: To the Glittering Other Side!
The Idolmaster Movie: Beyond the Brilliant Future!

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Dancing
tags.description: Centers around the art of dance.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

title.native: アイドルマスター シャイニーフェスタ
アイドルマスター ミリオンライブ！
アイドルマスター SideM

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1515331173983330306)

Nishigori graduated from the Toei Animation Institute and joined [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) as an in-betweener but he rapidly distinguished himself as a key animator. He was inspired to enter the field because he liked [Hidenori Matsubara](https://anilist.co/staff/107672/) and [Takeshi Honda](https://anilist.co/staff/103303/)'s drawings.

His first major role was serving as character animation director for [Top wo Nerae 2! Diebuster](https://anilist.co/anime/1002/Gunbuster-2-Diebuster/), with the task of adapting [Yoshiyuki Sadamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/98158/Yoshiyuki-Sadamoto)'s character designs for animation. This experience led him to become one of the main character designers at the studio, designing the iconic characters for [Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/).

He left Gainax to have his debut as director on [The Idolm@ster](https://anilist.co/anime/10278/The-Idol-Master/), a personal passion project since he's a great fan of the series. Several Gainax staff followed Nishigori to [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/) and worked on the series, alongside staff from newly formed [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/Trigger).

In 2018 he directed his original project [Darling in the Franxx](https://anilist.co/anime/99423/), once again reuniting with his Gainax friends spread among [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/), Trigger and [Studio Khara](https://anilist.co/studio/47/).

More recently he worked as character designer and chief animation director for [Hideaki Anno](https://anilist.co/staff/100111/)'s final Evangelion installment, [Evangelion: 3.0+1.0 Thrice Upon A Time](https://anilist.co/anime/3786/Evangelion-3010-Thrice-Upon-A-Time/).

Former adult game scenario writer. He is a creator of cult classic Shizuku, Kizuato and To Heart.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takahasi)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/331643934) | [Website](http://mazurka.moo.jp/)

While studying for a university degree in art, she was discovered by web artists [Shingo Yamashita](https://anilist.co/staff/114914/) and [Kenichi Kutsuna](https://anilist.co/staff/116007/), who recruited her to work on [Birdy Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/). She did not join any particular studio, but started her career as a freelancer.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/t_takasekun)

Originating from [Xebec](https://anilist.co/studio/27/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/isao__hayashi)

Originating from [Nakamura Production](https://anilist.co/studio/6658/Nakamura-Production). Affiliated with [Cloverworks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/imoji3)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamada_uk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/22HS_drill/) Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). Works outside anime: - Melty Blood: Type Lumina (Video Game, 2021) (Cut-in Animation Character Design, Animation Director, Key Animation)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamada_uk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/22HS_drill/) Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). Works outside anime: - Melty Blood: Type Lumina (Video Game, 2021) (Cut-in Animation Character Design, Animation Director, Key Animation)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuyu_yuyuo) | [Tumblr](https://yuyuoto.tumblr.com/)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/689yuri)
**Tomoko Fukunaga** is a Japanese animator and animation director.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/211927741)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/880805780844183553)

Affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks). 

Freelancer originating from [Doga Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/95/), formerly a [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) employee. 

Married to [Akira Amemiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100956/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/114233403)

Affiliated with [Yostar Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/6371/). Formerly part of [Trigger](https://anilist.co/studio/803/).
